decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge to control the board. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds flexibility and consistency to the deck. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive strategy, with a mix of lands that provide colored mana and utility lands like The One Ring and Arena of Glory.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using cards that do not require lands. By utilizing counterspells, card manipulation, and efficient creatures, the deck aims to quickly generate enough mana to cast Goblin Charbelcher and win the game on the spot. The deck also includes cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Thundertrap Trainer to further support the combo strategy. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards the combo finish.

This deck focuses on maximizing damage output quickly by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. It also benefits from the additional resource provided by the companion card Jegantha, the Wellspring. By maintaining a balance between aggression and control, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize, while also ensuring protection with cards like Stubborn Denial. With a diverse mana base and a mix of creature types, this deck is designed to be versatile and unpredictable in its approach to winning the game.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and medallions to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to create a storm of spells. The inclusion of Wish allows for flexibility in finding key combo pieces. The use of cards like Noxious Revival and Artist's Talent adds recursion and card advantage to keep the combo going. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells to achieve victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Amped Raptor. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Skyclave Apparition to control the board. The strategy includes using Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to pump up creatures and create a strong offense. It also includes cards like Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to win the game quickly by building a strong board presence and dealing damage efficiently.

This aggressive deck focuses on quickly casting spells with cascade to put pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ardent Plea and Shardless Agent, the deck aims to cascade into powerful spells like Crashing Footfalls and Scion of Draco to overwhelm the opponent. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help protect your creatures while Force of Negation provides interaction with the opponent's spells. With a mix of counter magic and powerful creatures, this deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on ramping up resources quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures, such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The strategy is to control the game by using cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes cards like Ugin's Labyrinth and Sowing Mycospawn to control the board and create advantage. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through sheer power and efficiency.

Control the game using artifacts and spells to disrupt your opponent's strategy while generating value and card advantage with Urza, Lord High Artificer and other powerful artifact cards. Use Urza's Saga and Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for key cards like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek, creating a powerful token engine. Utilize counterspells and removal spells to control the board and protect your key combo pieces. With a mix of artifact synergy and control elements, outlast your opponent and secure victory with a strong endgame presence.

The main concept of this Modern Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption. By utilizing cards like Archmage's Charm, Counterspell, and Force of Negation, as well as spells like Toxic Deluge and Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from establishing a strong board presence. Murktide Regent provides a powerful threat that can close out the game quickly, while cards like Psychic Frog and Subtlety offer additional ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy.
